thread.title: Pelosi jabs Trump during CNN town hall
thread.title_full: Pelosi jabs Trump during CNN town hall - POLITICO

author: Heather Caygle
title: Pelosi jabs Trump during CNN town hall
text:
House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi spewed verbal daggers at President Donald Trump on Tuesday night, saying she feels pity for the commander-in-chief and calling him “reckless,” “brash” and “so insecure.” Pelosi’s remarks came during an hour-long town hall on CNN during which she was asked a range of audience questions on everything Trump from the president's newly announced Supreme Court nominee Neil Gorsuch to how she feels about recent executive action banning refugees. 
Story Continued Below
“If you detect some impatience in my voice, it’s because your family is suffering and our president is reckless, reckless, and his administration is incompetent,” Pelosi (D-Calif.) said, answering a question from a Yemeni refugee about Trump’s controversial immigration order. 
Pelosi said Trump moved up his Supreme Court announcement, initially planned for Thursday, to deflect from critical news coverage of the refugee ban. 
“How and why they did this is because they’re grand illusionists. Any time they have a problem with something, they create another problem,” she said.

Trump picks Gorsuch for Supreme Court By Shane Goldmacher , Josh Gerstein and Matthew Nussbaum 
At one point, Pelosi had an emotional exchange with a mother in the audience who said her son was killed by an undocumented immigrant. The woman wanted to know how Pelosi could support so-called “sanctuary cities,” which help shield undocumented individuals from federal immigration authorities. 
“Which one of [your children] could you look in their eyes today and tell them that they’re expendable?” the woman, Laura Wilkerson, asked Pelosi while fighting back tears. Wilkerson appeared in a campaign ad supporting Trump for his stance on immigration. 
Trump signed an order last week stripping funding from sanctuary cities as part of a broader immigration crackdown. 
Pelosi, while offering sympathy for the woman’s loss, defended sanctuary cities, which she said don’t shield violent individuals, undocumented or not, from the law. 
“These are law-abiding citizens. It enables them to be there without being reported to [Immigration and Customs Enforcement] in case of another crime that they might bear witness to,” Pelosi said. 
White House 
How Trump got to yes on Gorsuch By Shane Goldmacher , Eliana Johnson and Josh Gerstein 
Later, Pelosi divulged additional details about her meeting with Trump and other congressional leaders last week during which the president insisted he was robbed of the popular vote due to widespread voter fraud. 
The California Democrat spoke up during the meeting, telling the president his widely debunked claim just wasn’t true. Trump’s response, according to Pelosi's retelling the episode on CNN: “And I’m not even counting California.” 
“You’re the president of the United States and you’re so insecure. This isn’t even true, it’s like the size of your inauguration,” Pelosi said. 
In discussing Gorsuch, Pelosi called Trump’s Supreme Court pick “well outside the mainstream of American legal thought,” echoing criticisms of other Democrats. Trump’s announcement, also seen live on CNN, came less than an hour before her town hall, leading Pelosi to joke that he was trying to "upstage" her.
